posts.text: The Trump administration is prepared to consider a proposal that allows Iran "token" nuclear enrichment if it leaves no possible path to a bomb, a senior U.S. official told Axios.
posts.author: zerohedge

posts.text: Cryptic crosswords look tricky, but there are conventions that can help newcomers. Most clues comprise a cryptic part and a straight definition. Our daily puzzle has both cryptic and regular clues. Try it now: http://econ.st/4b00C3i
posts.author: TheEconomist

posts.text:
BREAKING: Institutional investors sold a net -$8.3 billion of US equities last week, the 2nd-largest weekly sale on record.

Meanwhile, retail investors bought +$1.0 billion, posting their 5th consecutive weekly purchase.

Hedge funds bought +$1.2 billion, marking their 8th weekly purchase in the last 9.

In total, equity ETFs posted +$2.2 billion in inflows last week, while single stocks saw -$8.3 billion in outflows.

Single stocks have now seen outflows in 13 of the last 15 weeks, totaling -$52.0 billion.

Institutions are aggressively selling to retail and hedge funds.
posts.author: KobeissiLetter

posts.text:
Both the human brain and body, much like mycelial networks, dynamically sculpt their architecture through activity-dependent processes: high energy flow and usage reinforce and expand connections, pathways, and tissues, while low or absent activity triggers weakening, pruning, or regression—optimizing structure for efficiency and minimal metabolic waste in response to real-time demands.

We are a biological supercomputer that operates with a distributed network.  Our consciousness forms as a collaboration of cellular communication.
posts.author: BambroughKevin

posts.text:
You have never occupied the exact same space twice.

The sun isn't a stationary campfire—it’s a bullet tearing through the Milky Way at 500,000 miles per hour, dragging our entire world into the unknown.
posts.author: BambroughKevin
